page.title: 03TRANSPORT
page.content: of green lanes. today the main communication is by way of A34 the main Birmingham to Stratford Rd. The bus runs along here every hour but the expense of the return fare means that many stay in the village. There is also a rail link with Stratford and Leamington from Bearley Junction. This was once a large station in the heyday of the GWR but is now just a halt. The Stratford Upon Avon canal also joining Stratford and Birmingham runs close to the village crossing Salters lane in the second longest aquaduct in the country. Now no longer used for commerce it is an important leisure facility whether for cruising, fishing or walking. Bearley has never had many amenities and there are even fewer now that the
